title: Give Syndra her original's empowered W back.
body: her orginal empowered W let her use her W on ennemy's champions but without the moving and throwing, it was basically a stun.

replies.body: It was during her preview at I dunno which convention. It sadly did not make it live/pbe :(

Gamescom was the convention we previewed Syndra at before her release. Her empowered W there had an AOE knockup on landing. That felt really good to use, but wasn't appropriate for Syndra's kit unfortunately. I did go back a couple of years ago to see if there was a way to make it work after all (short duration/small AOE for example), conclusion was though that it adds a lot of power even then because of the way it creates a stationary target that's really easy to Q+E stun.
This is completely off topic. But what was it like creating Syndra? And would you do anything different now if you had the chance to revisit her?

Good fun, though pretty rushed compared to champion creation nowadays. If I was tackling her from scratch today the passive's the biggest thing I'd look at, I don't feel it's particularly hit the mark gameplay wise. It does have some useful power curve effects though, and I still like its thematic connection with Syndra's lore. Wouldn't want to put anything particularly complex there however, I feel Syndra's got about the right degree of difficulty/things to do in a fight.

I know you guys were playtesting some changes to her passive before, but they got iceboxed because of the end of the season. Will you guys be resuming that soonish (or at least is that the plan) or will you just shove any potential work on her to June with the rest of the Mages?

Edit: I don't want that to sound accusatory, I just want to know if I'm going to be looking at half a year for changes or just a couple months.

Not certain. Syndra's a champ we've been considering for the immobile mage update mid year, but one we're currently trending away from (feeling other champs would be higher value for that sort of work). If she's not included there I'd certainly like to see if we can do a bit of work on her at some other point, again though there are a bunch of other champs that I feel we should be prioritizing first.

>Syndra's a champ we've been considering for the immobile mage update mid year, but one we're currently trending away from 

If we're not including her in the mage update can we at least give her some numbers help? 50 damage on an ability at rank 1 is completely pathetic, I get why you nerfed it I just think you completely overshot the mark.

Hey meddler, i got a question, a theorical "what if" that got my attention right now. **This is not a request**, **nor the question is about balance**, but about design and its implications and if possible i would like to have your opinion.

What if the passive of Syndra only applied to the first spell maxed? 
How players would react to that, besides the knee-jerk reaction of such an important change? Would they feel cheated if they feel the need to max a spell first, but like the maxed effect of an other, or maybe they would feel compelled by the choice? Or maybe is just something that Syndra players would not like at all, but it would be interesting on another champion?

I' m asking this because LoL, as well as many other mobas that allow you to rank up spells, try to sell the fantasy of being able to customize the personal character growth during the game; this however falls flat in many cases, both in LoL and in similar games: there is one spell that for your role or position is almost always optimal to max first, in some cases you are even bound to max something second. There are many obvious exceptions to this ( udyr says hi ) but is widely spread on many champions.

And thing is, it is also widely accepted. "What should i max first" is an incredibly common question for starters.
I am not sure if that a thing requires a "fixing" too, because it has its own merits.
With this idea I enforce this choice on a champion that somehow thematically fits well, but i am not quite sure if it can be considered valuable: it is, as i said, forced.

Thanks in any case :)
